item.title: F√ºr Elise
item.description: I am still stuck in time zone limbo. It feels like purgatory. I fell asleep too early yesterday and woke up again at 11:00pm. Not happy about that, but feeling optimistic about today’s attempt. Because coffee. I spent these twilight hours reading and learning to play the piano. I’ve never given the piano an attempt and am enjoying playing it. I’ve chosen to learn Beethoven’s “F√ºr Elise”. It is a simpler song to learn because Beethoven made this song for a woman that he was in love with.

item.title: Beginnings
item.description: I’ve arrived in Chiang Mai and I feel great about what’s to come. 2 trains, 3 planes, and 32 hours went by faster than expected. Normally when traveling for vacation I get really excited and have high energy. This time it’s different because I have possibly 7 months of travel ahead of me and it’s not exactly vacation. While “excited” is a correct word to use: calm, relaxed, and happy are more accurate.

item.title: About
item.description: Documenting my travels abroad. Posting when I can. Photos are taken with a Fujifilm X-T30 II (XF27mm F2.8 R WR lens) and an iPhone 13 Pro. This site is hosted on GitHub pages, using hugo. While traveling I’m building GymRats. Elixir, Swift, and Kotlin are my loves. Phoenix, Cocoa, and Compose are my muses. I work with a 13-inch, M1, 2020 MacBook Pro. It is ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•. I’m learning Portuguese on Duolingo.
